data.name: Lugano Urban Discovery
data.abstract: With Mediterranean flair, Lugano offers all the advantages of a world-class city combined with the cachet of a small town.
data.description:
Go for a stroll to explore the city and enjoy local beers, wine and ice cream. Those who love a dose of culture can learn more about local products during a 2.5-hour tour in a friendly and cosy atmosphere. 
 * Open all year
 * Open every day
 * Min. of 10 to max. of 30 people
 * CHF 40 per person


More information [https://www.luganoregion.com/en/attractions-activities/day-trips-surroundings/detail/id/48274/urban-discovery-more]

data.name: Lugano - Unexpected Classic Tour
data.abstract: Past and present: this exceptional tour through classical Lugano is packed with surprises for visitors. Historic figures appear along the way, presenting scenes from the past in entertaining ways.
data.description: This guided walking tour is accompanied by two actors who take on the role of historical characters as they tell the story of the city, bringing the spirit of each era vividly to life. The itinerary takes in a number of historical monuments as well as modern buildings by internationally famous Ticino architects. The “Unexpected Classic Tour” takes place every Monday and is free of charge.

data.name: Lugano and its architecture
data.abstract: From the past to the present: There are a whole host of architectural jewels from the 20th and 21st century to discover on this walk through Lugano.
data.description:
The Ticino architectural tradition has its roots before the year 1000. Maestri Comacini, Intelvesi and Campionesi were born in this region. This tradition was renewed over the centuries.

A guided walk through Lugano gives you the opportunity to discover some of the most interesting buildings built on the shores of Lake Lugano in the 20th and 21st century. From Mario Chiattone to Livio Vacchini, from Rino Tami to Mario Botta, to the local university (USI) campus, our tour will show Lugano in an entirely new light: you’ll be able to admire it from an architect's perspective.

The guided tour is run in collaboration with i2a (Istituto Internazionale di Architettura) and you will be accompanied by a local architect.

data.name: Lugano – Monte San Salvatore
data.abstract: Monte San Salvatore in Lugano offers unique views over Lake Lugano, the Alps and the Po Valley. The funicular takes you to the summit in 12 minutes, where hiking trails, a viewing platform, a museum and a restaurant serving Ticino specialties await you.
data.description:
Monte San Salvatore in Lugano is a top destination for nature lovers and hiking enthusiasts. The funicular railroad takes you quickly and easily from Paradiso to the summit. From the viewing platform, you can enjoy a magnificent view over Lake Lugano, the Alps and as far as the Po Valley.

In the San Salvatore Museum, you can learn exciting facts about the geology and history of the region. Popular hiking trails lead from here to Carona or Morcote. Climbing fans will also get their money's worth on Monte San Salvatore.

The Ristorante Vetta serves typical Ticino dishes, perfect for a break with a view. The mountain is an experience all year round and ideal for a day trip.

data.name: Lake Lugano Cruises
data.abstract: At Lake Lugano, it is wonderfully easy to escape one’s daily routine: by enjoying a sunbath below palm trees, cruises on the lake or hiking tours through magnificent landscapes.
data.description:
Whether culture, nature or excursions into vibrating nightlife, the lake region offers all of it and then some.

A boat cruise is the perfect way to explore the diversity of the region: Morcote with its stately patrician houses and the Santa Maria del Sasso Church, an important renaissance building at a unique panoramic location with a clock tower dating from the late romantic era; or Gandria, the epitome of a quaint little fishing village at the shores of Lake Lugano.FACTS
Route: Lugano – Gandria – Lugano
Duration: app. 2 to 4 h
EXCURSION TIPS
 * Gandria and surrounding area
 * Monte San Salvatore
 * Swiss Customs Museum
 * Swissminiatur – a miniature Switzerland
 * Monte Generoso

FOOD & BEVERAGES
Coffee, tea, pastries, an innovative kitchen and delicious meals with appealing on-board service.TIMETABLE
All connections here [https://www.lakelugano.ch/en]TICKET
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]
RESERVATIONS
No seat reservation required – free seating.

data.name: Casino Lugano
data.abstract: Casino Lugano is a landmark in Ticino for entertainment.
data.description: Casino Lugano is a landmark in Ticino for entertainment, thanks to gaming offers completed by two bars, panoramic restaurant and an exclusive lounge&bar. Today, the Casino offers today over 400 last generation slot machines, 28 daily prize jackpots and 18 tables dedicated to the most classic casino games.

data.name: Discover the Lugano region the environmentally friendly way
data.abstract: Practical, environmentally friendly and appealing: PubliBike’s bike hire system is the ideal way to explore the area around Lugano without getting stuck in traffic or wasting time looking for a parking space.
data.description:
The environmentally friendly, efficient and healthy solution is captivatingly simple. Bikes are available to hire at 47 locations throughout Lugano and can be easily located using the free PubliBike app. The bikes can be unlocked with a smartphone or a pre-registered SwissPass. Once you’re done, simply return the bike to any PubliBike station. The bikes are available 24/7.

PubliBike [https://www.publibike.ch/en/publibike/]

data.name: Lakeside Lido di Lugano
data.abstract: The Lugano swimming resort "Lido", a place which everyone loves in Lugano, has managed to preserve its attractiveness and charm throughout years.
data.description: The Lugano Lido offers the visitor numerous opportunities: a wonderful fine sandy beach on the shores of Lake Ceresio, heated Olympic swimming pool, a medium size swimming pool, a diving pool with trampolines up to 10 m high, a pool suitable for children with water games, a beach volley court and a five-a-side football pitch.

data.name: Christmas lights in Lugano
data.abstract: With numerous entertainments and events, the Christmas holidays are a fabulous time to spend in Lugano.
data.description:
A magical world for children, which even adults love to partake in. The joy of being together, without necessarily having to stay in one’s home living room. The pleasure of buying presents at the market or in boutiques. 

This is the kind of Christmas that the City proposes and which will feature 37 very special days in the streets of the city centre so that the Christmas season can reach out to everyone.

data.name: Foxtrail – fun in Lugano
data.abstract: In Lugano, the fox takes chasers across the entire Mediterranean-style town. You'll search for secret treasure and will need to rescue knights, decipher ancient lettering and follow traces of blood.
data.description: The fox has laid its trails. Secret messages, hidden clues and many tricky and perplexing challenges show you the way from one stop to the next. You are out on the trail by yourself and never know what’s waiting in store for you – even people familiar with the region are bound to discover new things. The Foxtrail takes you through towns and countryside on foot and using various means of transport. The trails last between 1.5 and 4.5 hours. All you’ll need is good shoes and a mobile phone per group in case you need to call the hotline. Pricing depends on your age and the length of the trail. Simply book online through the website, print the starting instructions and enjoy solving the puzzles!

data.name: A visit to Lugano's parks and gardens
data.abstract: Did you know that Lugano boasts a unique Mediterranean-style climate that allows olive trees, cork oaks and palm trees to flourish side-by-side?
data.description:
A stroll through Lugano’s parks and gardens offers visitors a chance to enjoy the city’s lush greenery, and discover exotic plants and flowers as well as local varieties. The walk begins at the church of Santa Maria degli Angioli, leads through the Belvedere gardens and ends in the Parco Civico-Ciani, the city’s largest park and one of the most important in the whole of Switzerland. 

On one of Ticino’s many gloriously sunny days, nothing beats exploring Lugano’s parks and gardens, ice cream in hand, while enjoying the breathtaking scenery and the delightful Mediterranean climate

data.name: Explore street art in Lugano
data.abstract: This self-guided tour allows you to discover Lugano from the perspective of its street art.
data.description:
The Lugano Street Art Tour gives you the opportunity to explore numerous public works of art that have been created by AUL (Arte Urbana Lugano) and other private institutions over the years. The tour opens up a new and unusual side of Lugano that often goes unnoticed,

covering both the city centre and beyond. In addition to artworks in the city centre, the tour also explores hidden gems off the beaten tourist path, including in the small village of Bré on Monte Bré with its historic rural architecture and Sorengo with its futuristic new buildings.

All you need for the tour are a comfortable pair of shoes and the free Street Art Guide Lugano, which you can print out or open as a PDF on your smartphone or tablet.

data.name: Culinary cruise on Lake Lugano
data.description: On the cruise with Patricia Carminati, guests experience real hospitality on Lake Lugano. In the ship’s galley, they assist the cook in making risotto. Meanwhile, “Captain” Patricia is in charge of creating a pleasant atmosphere aboard – typically Lugano.

data.name: Grotto tour on Lake Lugano
data.abstract: The grotto tour takes you on a culinary tour of discovery by boat. Visitors are taken to the grottos, a kind of tavern, and picked up again two hours later.
data.description:
The idea arose because many of the cosy grottos on the shores of Lake Lugano can only be reached on foot or by boat. The boat sets out directly to Brasato, Polenta and Kerzenschein.

It sails during the summer months, starting in Lugano, then on to Paradiso and further to Grotto Pescatori via San Rocco and Caprino. From there, it’s on to Grotto Elvezia via Gandria and then back to Lugano.
More information [https://www.ticino.ch/en/commons/details/Grotti-Tour/150807.html]

For visitors who want to visit a grotto on foot, the hike from Caprino to Cantine di Gandria along Lake Lugano is highly recommended. A lot of the grottos are along the way and are tempting places to make a stop for a tasty meal or glass of wine.
More information [https://www.ticino.ch/en/itineraries/details/From-Caprino-to-Cantine-di-Gandria-along-Lake-Lugano/138326.html]

data.name: Scenic route above Lake Lugano
data.abstract: The steep chestnut forests of the Sottoceneri region offer the ideal backdrop to a hard day's mountain biking.
data.description:
Discover this for yourself by taking the scenic tour from picturesque Morcote across Monte Arbostora. Sensational views of Lake Lugano will compete with endless single trails for your attention on the second part of the tour. In a word, this tour is a byword for unparalleled biking pleasure in a fabulous landscape. What more could a biker want?
Begin of tour:MorcotePoint of arrival:MorcoteAccess starting point:Busses from MelideAccess point of arrival:Busses to MelidePanorama:Gorgeous views of Lake LuganoPhysical fitness:medium difficultyDifficulty:medium difficultyTotal altitude meters:655 mHiking time:2-3hLength:25.8 kmSeason:January - DecemberGastronomy:Morcote, Carona, CarabbiaOvernight:MorcoteVarious:Village center of Morcote and of Carona
Morcote - Vico Morcote - Baslona - Alpe Vicania - Madonna d'Ongero - Carona - Carabbia - Morcote

From Morcote, take a side street across Vico Morcote and ascend in this fashion to Baslona. Continue onwards towards Carona, past Alpe Vicania and the Chapel of Madonna d�Ongero (Kapelle Madonna d�Ongero). Leave Carabbia and return to Morcote via a long Single Trail requiring biking skill and technique.

Pictures: http://www.bike-explorer.ch

data.name: Emotions fly high above Lake Lugano
data.abstract: Soaring high above Lugano in a hot air balloon and marvelling at the beautiful landscape.
data.description: Peering down upon the beauty of Lugano and its surroundings from a bird’s eye view is an unforgettable experience! The autumnal landscape is especially alluring, when the chestnut trees change colour and nature is steeped in a golden light. But of course the trip is also wonderful at other times of the year. For example, how about a sunrise flight or brunch in the balloon?

data.name: Wine cellar visits & Beer Tastings in Lugano Region
data.abstract: Choose the tasting most agreeable to your palate at one of the producers in the Lugano Region and let yourself be inspired by the various food and wine tasting events offered throughout the year.
data.description:
The local producers [https://www.luganoregion.com/en/see-do/gastronomy-traditions/wine-cellars-and-breweries] are at your complete disposal to organize guided tours and tastings at their farm. During the visits you will have the opportunity to meet different producers and taste the uniqueness of their products and our local products.

Experienced staff will guide you on an unforgettable journey to discover delicious flavours and surprising emotions.

event.location: The participant must reach the winery individually.

data.name: Via Nassa
data.abstract: In the heart of the historic city centre, just behind the lakefront promenade, lies Lugano’s principal shopping street.
data.description:
The chic Via Nassa. With its boutiques, antiquarian bookshops and jewellers’, it elevates window-shopping to an art form; 270 metres of covered arcades make for a shady, pleasant stroll, even in high summer. Mouth-watering food emporia and popular department stores also add to the appeal of Lugano’s top address. 

Most shops on the Via Nassa are open on weekdays to 6.30pm and on Saturdays to 5pm. They are closed on Sundays.

data.name: San Michele Park
data.abstract: The San Michele Park sits high above Lugano and offers spectacular views of the city, the lake and the mountains. The typically southern vegetation is sure to thrill many of its visitors too.
data.description:
This park, with 12,000 square metres of green space, sits in Castagnola, on the slopes of Monte Brè. It is known not only for its beauty but also its wonderful architectural elements: the chapel dedicated to San Michele, the rustic cottage and a number of stone sculptures.

Behind the chapel dedicated to San Michele, you’ll find the main terrace of the park. From this privileged position, you can admire the gulf of Lugano, the lakefront and Monte San Salvatore. The view extends as far as the peaks of the Alps in a variety of shapes and colours that glow incandescent as the sun goes down. On the left-hand side, the view stretches from Melide, Campione and Bissone to the plains of the river Po.

San Michele Park also offers rich vegetation: its paths lead through typical southern vegetation such as wisteria, oleander, oak, elm, hornbeam, ash and laurel trees.

image.name: San Michele Park

data.name: Ciani Park
data.abstract: Located on the shores of Lake Lugano, this 63,000 square metre park constitutes the city’s green lung. Here you can recover from the hustle and bustle of the city as you walk along paths lined by magnificent centuries-old trees.
data.description:
The paths wind through beautiful flower beds, lined with statues and fountains, and are framed by the meticulously manicured English lawn. The park is divided into two areas. The first area in the vicinity of the Villa Ciani can be reached through the main entrance at the end of the waterside promenade. This area has both the features of an Italian and an English garden: lush flower beds alternate with green spaces and trees and shrubs from all over the world. 

The second area extends from the jetty to the Cassarate River and has a "wilder" and more original character. Here you will find oak, lime, plane and maple trees, all typical representatives of the Ticino forests. Within this forested area there is a children's playground with numerous games for children of all ages. 

The Parco Ciani is also home to various buildings: the Villa Ciani, the Convention Centre, a jetty, the Natural History Museum and the Cantonal Library.

data.name: Photo Spot Swissminiatur
data.abstract: Opened in 1959, Swissminiatur is the largest open-air miniature museum in Switzerland. It is located in Melide on the shores of Lake Lugano. There are more than 100 models of the most famous buildings, monuments and means of transport in Switzerland, all at the unusual scale of 1:25. Traditional methods and innovative processes come together to create genuine miniature masterpieces. Admire precision craftsmanship, faithful to the original and executed with loving care.
data.description:
Address:
Via Cantonale 13
6815 Melide

Parking:
public and paid parking spaces in the surroundings of the park

data.name: ViaGottardo - It all began with the devil
data.abstract: Route: Basle/Schaffhausen - Lake Lucerne - Gotthard pass Lugano - Chiasso
data.description: Myth and history are omnipresent along the ViaGottardo. Two branches from Basle and Schaffhausen converge on the Lake of Lucerne and continue across the Gotthard pass to Chiasso. Again and again the traditional Swiss transit route provides new surprises. Apart from well-known attractions, natural and cultural treasures in hiding along the route are just waiting to be discovered.

image.name: viaGottardo.jpg
image.copyrightHolder: Foto Andres Betschart © ViaStoria / www.viastoria.ch

data.name: Monte Generoso
data.abstract: At the southern end of Lake Lugano is the 1,704 metre high Monte Generoso. This lofty altitude makes it without a doubt the best mountain for views in the canton of Ticino.
data.description:
The new restaurant “Fiore di pietra” (stone flower) created by the famous architect Mario Botta stands majestically on a rugged plateau on the mountain. Its windows offer breathtaking 360° panoramic views, taking in the lakes, the city of Lugano as well as the Matterhorn and Jungfrau all the way to the Bernina Range.

Nostalgic journey to the summit
A cog railway has been taking visitors up to the peak of Monte Generoso for 125 to enjoy these breathtaking views. It is about 9km long and runs along a magical stretch of mountain scenery in the Monte Generoso nature park. In addition to electric trains, nostalgic modes of transport also use this cog railway line, including the oldest steam train still in operation in Switzerland, built in 1890, and trains from the 1950s. A ride in these trains brings the time of the Belle Époque back to life.

Activities on and around the mountain
There is much to discover on Monte Generoso: Keen hikers can explore the mountain on more than 51km of hiking trails. The Nature Trail and the Ice Pits Nevere are just two of the many hiking paths. The Ice Pits Nevere trail takes hikers to restored ice huts, which were once used to chill milk before it was churned into butter. The brave can marvel at the landscape around Monte Generoso from the air by paragliding from the top. Flights start on Monte Generoso and glide in different directions over the lakes, countryside and towns.

INFORMATION
How to get there:
Drive or take public transportation from Lugano to Capolago-Riva San Vitale, from there take the Monte Generoso mountain train to the top of Monte Generoso.

Sunset:
If you get a chance, don’t miss the sunset in Ticino. It’s a truly spectacular experience.

Food/drink:
The “Fiore di pietra” gourmet restaurant and “Generoso” self-service restaurant will satisfy your hunger and thirst after a leisurely stroll or strenuous hike.

Families:
The “Bear Cave” is about 30 minutes from the “Fiore di pietra” building on the Italian side of the mountain. Some 60,000 years ago, it was home to more than 800 cave bears. The cave's length is 200m, 70m of which have been made accessible to visitors. You need sturdy shoes, hiking gear and a hat to follow in the footsteps of the cave bears.

Please note:
Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass / GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.

More information about Monte Generoso [https://www.montegeneroso.ch/en]


MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=GenerosoVetta]

additionalDescriptions.description: The Ferrovia Monte Generoso stands out for its exclusive locations, ideal for tasting culinary excellence, celebrating memorable private events or holding impactful corporate meetings. At 1'704 meters above sea level stands the "Fiore di pietra", an architectural gem that has two restaurants inside: one à la carte for high-class gastronomic experiences and one self-service, perfect for convivial moments. In addition, there is also a unique panoramic conference room inside, capable of accommodating up to 80 people and perfectly adaptable to different needs. At the midway station, however, you cannot miss the iconic Bellavista Buffet. This charming grotto offers a cozy setting with about 40 places, also ideal for private events. Here regional, zero-mile cuisine reigns supreme, delighting guests with traditional Ticino dishes.

What better place to begin your life as a couple than on the cogwheel train and the summit of Monte Generoso? Between breathtaking views and boundless valleys, the "Fiore di pietra" offers a fairytale stage for your wedding. With its distinctive architecture and a 360-degree panoramic terrace, every moment is transformed into an unforgettable memory, embraced by nature and the sky. At this magical venue, every detail contributes to making your special day a daydream.

data.name: Ayurveda and spa
data.abstract: An Ayurvedic break for women in an Indian oasis with a view of Lake Lugano.
data.description: The Shalini Ayurveda Centre is located in Carona. In this women-only oasis of peace and quiet, with a view of the lake and Monte Generoso, visitors enjoy treatments from the therapeutic tradition of Kerala. The Indian science and philosophy of Ayurveda deals with all aspects of the human experience, including affectivity and female health. During their stay, the women can enhance their knowledge of health issues, especially topics such as motherhood, periods, sexuality, relationships and feminine energy. The retreat also helps women to live generally more balanced and happier lives.

data.name: Hermann Hesse Foundation
data.abstract: Siddhartha, Narziss and Goldmund or Klingsors letzter Sommer - some of the most important works by Hermann Hesse were written in Montagnola, in the Casa Camuzzi. Today you can visit the Museo Hermann Hesse - located in an idyllic spot above Lake Lugano.
data.description:
Personal objects, photos, books and watercolor paintings tell of the moving life of the German writer Hermann Hesse. During his years in Ticino he wrote with views of the nearby Lake Lugano - in an apartment of the picturesque little castle that went by the humble name of Casa Camuzzi. Besides short stories, some of his most important works - such as Siddharta, Narziss and Goldmund or Klingsors letzter Sommer, were written here. 

Directly by the former dwelling and place of work of the writer, today you discover the Hermann Hesse Museum in the Torre Camuzzi. In addition to the permanent exhibition, here visitors enjoy thematic shows, lectures, concerts, films and readings. And its no wonder that beautiful walks in the surrounding landscape that once inspired the poet and writer also lure people here.

data.name: Lakeshore promenade
data.abstract: The lakeshore promenade in Lugano with its Mediterranean atmosphere is an inviting place for tourists and locals to enjoy a stroll.
data.description:
The promenade is the perfect place to leave the hustle and bustle of everyday life behind and to just be in the moment. 

A walk along the lakeshore promenade takes you through numerous parks including the Belvedere Gardens, where nature and culture form a pleasing blend.

data.name: Monte Lema
data.abstract: Monte Lema is situated between Lake Lugano and Lake Maggiore. At 1,624 metres above sea level, the mountain towers above the Malcantone region and offers panoramic views across southern Ticino and beyond. Monte Lema is the starting point for numerous hikes and bike tours, but also offers culinary highlights and unique views of the stars.
data.description:
Not far from the town of Lugano, in the heart of the Malcantone region, Monte Lema rises to the sky. Easily accessible by cable car, the panoramic view from the upper station is unrivalled. The view extends from the rolling, densely wooded hills of Malcantone with its chestnut forests and picturesque villages to the town of Lugano. If you walk 10 minutes from the upper station to the peak on a clear day, you will be rewarded with a view of the Bernese and Valais Alps.

The restaurant is accessible via a barrier-free path. A spacious terrace and two cosy dining rooms in the restaurant invite you to linger. Typical Ticino dishes are served, ranging from polenta to the famous torta di pane (bread cake). There are also 22 simple beds available in the guest house. A night on the summit is unforgettable.

It is just a short walk from the restaurant to the observatory. During a guided tour, guests can immerse themselves in the vastness of the universe. The stars suddenly seem so much closer. Numerous events are held on Monte Lema during the summer too. For example, a moonlit hike or yoga with a view.

Monte Lema is also the starting point for numerous hikes. Around 80 kilometres of hiking trails are waiting to be discovered. Leisurely circular hikes are ideal for hours of enjoyment. If you are looking for a greater challenge, you can undertake the famous ridge hike to Monte Tamaro. Impressive views are guaranteed. Bikers can expend their excess energy on a wide variety of trails.

Getting there: Take the train from Bellinzona or Lugano to Lamone-Cadempino, bus directly to Miglieglia, cable car to Monte Lema.

DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=MonteLema]

data.name: Monte Tamaro
data.abstract: The Monte Tamaro lies in the triangle between Lugano, Bellinzona and Locarno. It is famous for the Santa Maria degli Angeli church designed by Mario Botta and the scenic ridge walk from Monte Lema.
data.description:
Leaving from Rivera, the cable car climbs to Alpe Foppa [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/food-wine/restaurant/restaurant-alpe-foppa/]at 1,530 metres. The telecommunications mast is a good 300 metres higher, while the actual Tamaro summit is 1,962 metres above sea level. On a clear day you can see the Monte Rosa Massif from the summit and on the Lema hike. There are hiking routes in all directions, and mountain bikers love the downhill routes and the bike park.

The mountain restaurant, the summer toboggan run, the zip wire, the large children’s playground at the upper station and the adventure high ropes park [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/suspension-rope-park-of-the-monte-tamaro/]at the middle station combine to make Monte Tamaro a mountain packed with adventure. The Splash & Spa Tamaro [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/splash-e-spa-aquapark/]in Rivera, a water park spread across more than 10,000 square metres, is also a real delight for water babies.

Altitude: 1,962 metres 
How to get there: Train from Lugano [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/lugano/]or Bellinzona [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/bellinzona/]to Rivera-Bironico, 15-minute walk to the valley station, two-stage cable car to Alpe Foppa (1,530 metres) 
Views: To the north across the Magadino plain to Bellinzona, the Ticino mountains to the Gotthard region and the Bernese Oberland; to the south-east the Dent della Vecchia and Monte Generoso [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/destinations/monte-generoso-and-valle-di-muggio/]
Attractions: Church of Santa Maria degli Angeli [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/cappella-santa-maria-degli-angeli/]by Mario Botta, paintings by Enzo Cucchi, summer toboggan run, long zip wire, large playground, adventure park (middle station) 
Food and drink: Alpe Foppa self-service restaurant with seating for 400 
Accommodation: Capanna Tamaro UTOE mountain hut (next to the mast, one hour from Alpe Foppa): 53 sleeping spaces 
Groups: Alpe Foppa: meeting room, seating for 140, traditional cuisine, mainly Ticino specialities such as Ticino polenta with two types of cheese [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/experiences/food-wine/polenta-ticinese/]
Winter: Closed 
Special comments: Splash & Spa Tamaro water park in Rivera (open all year around)
Discounted mountain ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/swiss-travel-pass/]/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.

data.name: Photo Spot Monte San Giorgio
data.abstract: The Mendrisiotto and southern Lake Lugano region are dotted with highlights. Take, for example, the narrow lanes in the heart of Bissone, home to numerous artists and Francesco Borromini (1599–1667), the “starchitect” of the Renaissance period. The green “pyramid” on the other side of the lake is a UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site: fossils of fish and species of reptiles have been found on Monte San Giorgio, testifying to life on Earth more than 200 million years ago.
data.description:
Address:
Via Maroggia 
6816 Bissone

Parking: 
On left-hand side of the road, subject to a fee

Footpath: 
1 minute, exercise caution when crossing the road

image.name: 2016.jpg
image.copyrightHolder: jacquesperler.ch

data.name: Piazza della Riforma
data.abstract: Piazza della Riforma in Lugano is the vibrant center of the city, surrounded by historic buildings, cafés and restaurants. Cultural events take place here and the square is the ideal starting point for exploring sights such as Lake Lugano and Parco Ciani.
data.description:
Piazza della Riforma is the lively heart of Lugano and a popular meeting place for locals and tourists alike. The square is surrounded by historic buildings in neoclassical style and provides an impressive backdrop for events and festivals.

Lugano's town hall, an architectural highlight of the city, is located on the piazza. In the summer months, the square is often used for open-air concerts and cultural events. The many cafés and restaurants invite you to relax.

Numerous shopping streets also start here, inviting you to take a stroll. Piazza della Riforma is the ideal starting point for exploring the city center, with sights such as Parco Ciani and Lake Lugano just a short distance away.

Especially in spring and summer, the square is a popular place for a coffee break or an aperitivo in the open air. The good transport links also make the piazza easily accessible for day trippers.
